term.title: assessor

item.text: Person, assigned by an accreditation body, with relevant professional expertise and experience who can determine the competence of a laboratory.

notes.item: The assessor may work alone or as part of a team and be engaged in a voluntary or paid capacity.
The work of an assessor is often referred to as "assessment" and sometimes as "peer review".
Depending on the role and responsibilities of an assessor, terms such as "lead assessor" and "technical assessor" are often used.

sources.item: PAC, 2021, 93, 997. 'Metrological and quality concepts in analytical chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 2021)' on page 1020 (https://doi.org/10.1515/pac-2019-0819)
